required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Non Interventional Study To Asses The Safety, Effectiveness And Tolerability Of Quinapril (Acupil®) In An Indian Population
clinical_study.official_title: ASSET (Acupil® Non Interventional Study For Evaluation Of Safety Effectiveness And Tolerability)

brief_summary.textblock: This is a prospective, non-interventional, non comparative drug study. The efficacy of Quinapril in Asian population has been evaluated, but specifically in Indian patients the data is sparse. Data in a real world setting in a large population of Indian patients would shed more light on the safety, tolerability and effectiveness of Quinapril in the Indian population.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.description: Any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug was considered an AE, without regard to possibility of causal relationship. Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAE): those which occurred or worsened after baseline. An AE resulting in any of the following outcomes, or deemed to be significant for any other reason, was considered to be a SAE: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; a life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Value at week 12 minus value at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in Diastolic Blood Pressure (DBP) at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: Value at week 12 minus value at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in SBP at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Value at week 52 minus value at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Baseline in DBP at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: Value at week 52 minus value at baseline.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Pre-treatment in SBP at Week 0
secondary_outcome.description: Value at Week 0 minus value at pre-treatment. Pre-treatment BP was the last BP recorded before taking study medication from retrospective data. If no such value was available, the earliest retrospective BP value from medical records was considered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change From Pre-treatment in DBP at Week 0
secondary_outcome.description: Value at Week 0 minus value at pre-treatment. Pre-treatment BP was the last BP recorded before taking study medication from retrospective data. If no such value was available, the earliest retrospective BP value from medical records was considered.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving BP Goal at Week 12
secondary_outcome.description: The status of achieving a participant's goal BP at Week 12 was yes (at goal) or no (not at goal). The BP goal also depended on the participant's status of "Diabetes Mellitus (DM) or renal disease". To be considered at goal, SBP/DBP must be less than 140/90 mmHg for participants without DM or renal disease and SBP/DBP must be less than 130/80 mmHg for participants with DM or renal disease.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Achievement of BP Goal at Week 52
secondary_outcome.description: The status of achieving a participant's goal BP at week 52 was yes (at goal) or no (not at goal). The BP goal also depended on the participant's status of "DM or renal disease". To be considered at goal, SBP/DBP must be less than 140/90 mmHg for participants without DM or renal disease and SBP/DBP must be less than 130/80 mmHg for participants with DM or renal disease.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to week 52 or early termination
secondary_outcome.description: Time in weeks to the first "taking additional antihypertensive medication" since Quinapril therapy began.

secondary_outcome.measure: Mean Daily Dose of Study Medication
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to week 52 or early termination
secondary_outcome.description: The mean daily dose of the study medication was calculated by dividing the total dose (sum of the daily doses) in the study by the treatment duration.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Preference for add-on Anti-hypertensive Therapy
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to week 52 or early termination
secondary_outcome.description: The first add-on antihypertensive therapy for each participant was the first additional antihypertensive medication since initiation of Quinapril. If the participant did not require any such add-on medication, the first add-on antihypertensive therapy was "None".

intervention.description: per label as non interventional study

study_pop.textblock: 400 patients will be included in this non-interventional study. Only hypertensive subjects, over the age of 18 years, and who have already been receiving Acupil® for a minimum duration of 4 weeks will be included in the study.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients already on therapy with Acupil® for a minimum period of 4 weeks, Evidence of a personally signed and dated informed consent document
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients having a Week 0 visit blood pressure reading of more than 180/110 mm of Hg will not be eligible to participate in the study.
- Women of child bearing age, not willing to use contraceptives, will not be eligible for the study
- Women using oral contraceptives will also not be included in the study
- Patients who have received any drug other than Acupil® as the first prescribed antihypertensive would not be eligible for enrollment into the trial
- Patients having any complication at Week 0 visit which would require more thorough investigations or who required more than one anti-hypertensive drug at the time of initiation of their therapy will not be included in the study
- Patients having any contraindications as per the LPD of Acupil®

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

group.title: Quinapril
group.description: Quinapril, starting at a dose of 10 milligram (mg) up to 80 mg once per day orally in accordance with the locally approved prescribing information, in participants who had already been receiving Quinapril for a minimum duration of 4 weeks.

group.title: Quinapril
group.description: Quinapril, starting at a dose of 10 milligram (mg) up to 80 mg once per day orally in accordance with the locally approved prescribing information, in participants who had already been receiving Quinapril for a minimum duration of 4 weeks.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
outcome.description: Any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug was considered an AE, without regard to possibility of causal relationship. Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAE): those which occurred or worsened after baseline. An AE resulting in any of the following outcomes, or deemed to be significant for any other reason, was considered to be a SAE: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; a life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly.
outcome.population: Full analysis set (FAS) included participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication including those who took it before enrollment.

group.title: Quinapril
group.description: Quinapril, starting at a dose of 10 milligram (mg) up to 80 mg once per day orally in accordance with the locally approved prescribing information, in participants who had already been receiving Quinapril for a minimum duration of 4 weeks.

measure.title: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
measure.description: Any untoward medical occurrence in a participant who received study drug was considered an AE, without regard to possibility of causal relationship. Treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAE): those which occurred or worsened after baseline. An AE resulting in any of the following outcomes, or deemed to be significant for any other reason, was considered to be a SAE: death; initial or prolonged inpatient hospitalization; a life-threatening experience (immediate risk of dying); persistent or significant disability/incapacity; congenital anomaly.
measure.population: Full analysis set (FAS) included participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication including those who took it before enrollment.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in Systolic Blood Pressure (SBP) at Week 12
outcome.description: Value at week 12 minus value at baseline.
outcome.population: FAS included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication including those who took it before enrollment. Missing values were imputed by last-observation-carried forward (LOCF).

group.title: Quinapril
group.description: Quinapril, starting at a dose of 10 milligram (mg) up to 80 mg once per day orally in accordance with the locally approved prescribing information, in participants who had already been receiving Quinapril for a minimum duration of 4 weeks.

measure.population: FAS included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication including those who took it before enrollment. Missing values were imputed by last-observation-carried forward (LOCF).

outcome.description: Value at week 12 minus value at baseline.
outcome.population: FAS included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication including those who took it before enrollment. Missing values were imputed by LOCF.

group.title: Quinapril
group.description: Quinapril, starting at a dose of 10 milligram (mg) up to 80 mg once per day orally in accordance with the locally approved prescribing information, in participants who had already been receiving Quinapril for a minimum duration of 4 weeks.

outcome.title: Change From Baseline in SBP at Week 52
outcome.description: Value at week 52 minus value at baseline.
outcome.population: The “full analysis set – follow up” (FAS-FU) included the subset of participants who had at least 1 additional BP measurement. This analysis was not conducted because only 2 participants were eligible for inclusion in the FAS-FU.

outcome.title: Change From Pre-treatment in SBP at Week 0
outcome.description: Value at Week 0 minus value at pre-treatment. Pre-treatment BP was the last BP recorded before taking study medication from retrospective data. If no such value was available, the earliest retrospective BP value from medical records was considered.
outcome.population: FAS included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication including those who took it before enrolment. Missing values were imputed by LOCF.

group.title: Quinapril
group.description: Quinapril, starting at a dose of 10 milligram (mg) up to 80 mg once per day orally in accordance with the locally approved prescribing information, in participants who had already been receiving Quinapril for a minimum duration of 4 weeks.

measure.title: Change From Pre-treatment in DBP at Week 0
measure.description: Value at Week 0 minus value at pre-treatment. Pre-treatment BP was the last BP recorded before taking study medication from retrospective data. If no such value was available, the earliest retrospective BP value from medical records was considered.
measure.population: FAS included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication including those who took it before enrolment. Missing values were imputed by LOCF.

outcome.title: Number of Participants Achieving BP Goal at Week 12
outcome.description: The status of achieving a participant’s goal BP at Week 12 was yes (at goal) or no (not at goal). The BP goal also depended on the participant’s status of “Diabetes Mellitus (DM) or renal disease”. To be considered at goal, SBP/DBP must be less than 140/90 mmHg for participants without DM or renal disease and SBP/DBP must be less than 130/80 mmHg for participants with DM or renal disease.
outcome.population: FAS included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication including those who took it before enrolment. Subgroup analysis was performed for each subgroup of participants in the FAS defined by DM or renal disease status. Missing values were imputed by LOCF.

group.title: Quinapril

The BP goal also depended on the participant’s status of “Diabetes Mellitus (DM) or renal disease”. To be considered at goal, SBP/DBP must be less than 140/90 mmHg for participants without DM or renal disease and SBP/DBP must be less than 130/80 mmHg for participants with DM or renal disease.
measure.population: FAS included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication including those who took it before enrolment. Subgroup analysis was performed for each subgroup of participants in the FAS defined by DM or renal disease status. Missing values were imputed by LOCF.

To be considered at goal, SBP/DBP must be less than 140/90 mmHg for participants without DM or renal disease and SBP/DBP must be less than 130/80 mmHg for participants with DM or renal disease.
outcome.population: The FAS-FU included the subset of participants who had at least 1 additional BP measurement. This analysis was not conducted because only 2 participants were eligible for inclusion in the FAS-FU.

outcome.title: Duration of Monotherapy With Quinapril
outcome.description: Time in weeks to the first “taking additional antihypertensive medication” since Quinapril therapy began.
outcome.time_frame: Baseline up to week 52 or early termination
outcome.population: FAS included all participants who received at least 1 dose of study medication including those who took it before enrollment. Missing values were not imputed. Due to limited number of participants available, the analysis could not be performed.

reported_events.desc: The same event may appear as both an AE and a SAE. However, what is presented are distinct events. An event may be categorized as serious in one subject and as nonserious in another subject, or one subject may have experienced both a serious and nonserious event during the study.

group.title: Quinapril
group.description: Quinapril, starting at a dose of 10 milligram (mg) up to 80 mg once per day orally in accordance with the locally approved prescribing information, in participants who had already been receiving Quinapril for a minimum duration of 4 weeks.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.
